General procedure for setting permissions
Access permissions define the ability to read, edit, delete and create new instances of an object type.
For correct access permissions granting the following configuration order must be observed:
1. Access control type
The main setting of access permissions to type instances is the definition of
"Permissions control type"
in the object type profile.
When creating a new object type with the "Object" [SYS_OBJECT] parent, "System permission control" is set by default. In other cases, the permission control is inherited from the parent type.
When copying an object type, the permission control of the original type is preserved.
For more information about permission control types for object type instances, refer to the
article
.
2. Setting default permissions
Default permissions are set in the object type profile optionally
when the following permissions control types are selected
:
* All users have configured permissions for all instances of the type;
* System control of permissions;
* System control of permissions by group.
Default permissions apply only to new objects. To apply these permissions to all existing objects of the type, click the "Apply default permissions to existing objects" button.
Permission recalculation should be performed with caution, as previously configured default permissions may include special access logic, and if recalculated, they will be applied to already existing objects.
When configuring permissions for structural groups, only users directly included in the structural group are considered, as group nesting is not supported in this context.
Access permissions for actions in the "Restricted" section take precedence over permissions granted for actions in the "Allowed" section.
Find more on applying access permissions
here
.

3. Access to system objects
If local access to the objects is required, go to the main menu section "Administration" → "Access control" → "Access to objects".
On the page that opens, select the object type and instances of the type to which the local access permission settings should be applied.
Then, using the
button, select the security principal type for which access is to be set up.
Then using the checkboxes the permissions are granted and denied.
The full list of types in the "Object type" drop-down menu becomes available after clicking the "Show all types" button
. This button is displayed if the user has the "Run" permission for
"View system types in the "Object type" registry"
.
When the "Object type" is selected, a button
will also appear next to the field. Clicking it will display the full list of available instances of this type in the registry:
